fields.headline: Trump plants bomb, says Obamacare 'imploding'
fields.bodyText: Trump planted a time bomb under the Affordable Care Act by scrapping vital federal subsidies that help insurers extend quality coverage to low-income recipients. Then Trump said Obamacare was “imploding”. Read our coverage The late-night move followed an order by Trump earlier Thursday that ACA standards be dropped for some health insurance plans, allowing for cheaper coverage – which critics say also won’t cover much. About 12.7 million people rely on health insurance marketplaces created by the law. Trump became the first sitting president to address the annual Values Voter Summit. “Everyone here today is brought together by the same shared and timeless values,” said the thrice-married socialite and reality TV star. Read our coverage Trump has threatened to terminate the 2015 Iran nuclear deal if Congress and US allies fail to amend the agreement. He said he would not continue to certify the agreement to Congress, but stopped short of canceling it. Read our coverage A close associate of the former national security adviser Michael Flynn arranged a covert investigation into Hillary Clinton’s use of a private email server when she was secretary of state, and through intermediaries turned to a person with knowledge of the “dark web” for help. Read our coverage The Minute is taking a break as of today, but you can catch up with all the latest US news and politics every morning with the Guardian US’s daily email briefing.
